Class IndexGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • Objects.IndexGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileIOInterface, java.io.Serializable

extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, FileIOInterface
    See Also:

      • IndexGroup

        public IndexGroup(java.lang.Integer indexGroupID,
                  java.lang.Integer currentNumOfStudents,
                  java.lang.Integer maxNumOfStudents,
                  java.lang.String indexGroupName,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Lesson> lessonList,
                  Waitlist waitlist)
        Creates a new IndexGroup with the given ID, current number of students, maximum number of students, name, ArrayList of Lessons, and Waitlist of the index group.
        Parameters:
        indexGroupID - This IndexGroup's ID.
        currentNumOfStudents - This IndexGroup's current number of students registered.
        maxNumOfStudents - This IndexGroup's maximum number of students that can be registered.
        indexGroupName - This IndexGroup's name.
        lessonList - This IndexGroup's ArrayList of Lessons.
        waitlist - This IndexGroup's Waitlist.

        Returns:

      • checkVacancies

        public boolean checkVacancies()
        Checks if there are vacancies available in this IndexGroup by calculating the difference of the current number of students registered and the maximum number of students that can be registered.
        Returns:
        boolean(true / false)

      • updateVacancies

        public void updateVacancies(char operator)
        Update vacancies based on the given operator by incrementing or decrementing the current number of students registered in this IndexGroup.
        Parameters:
        operator - The operation to update the vacancy. + to increment vacancy, - to decrement vacancy.

      • updateIndexGroupObject

        public void updateIndexGroupObject(IndexGroup indexGroupToUpdate)
